category.term: 0~Florence and the Machine~MTV Networks Company~Anne Shirley~Daniel Radcliffe
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Japan, Australia, the U.S: Florence + The Machine will rumble through all those places and more this year, and the past Grammy nominees just revealed a string of spring headlining dates earlier this week. Just one problem: we don't spy a single Canadian stop on the ethereal act's current itinerary.

There, there... No need to fling yourself through a skylight. Flo and co. have shared something today that might act as some consolation.

Here, have a music video. It's for Ceremonialsâ€™ "Lover to Lover," and it's posted below.

In the new clip, frontwoman Florence Welch isn't revelling with Great Gatsby extras, or making like Anne Shirley to recreate the Lady of Shalott. (Nobody likes repeating themselves, after all.) And even though Harry Potter's Daniel Radcliffe just told MSN UK that he'd "love to work with Florence and the Machine," there's no sign of the boy wizard, either.

This one's a straightforward performance video: just Florence, The Machine and a spotlight. Did we say the clip was something of a wee consolation prize? For all of us who won't get the chance to see them this spring, it's probably more a glimpse of what we're missing.

Welch recently told MTV News what she's planning for the American leg of her tour, which launches April 14 in Santa Barbara, CA: "In a way, it's not going to be too big a production; we've done a lot of quite extravagant stuff, and that's been amazing, but for this tour, it's definitely going to be about showcasing the music," she said. "The songs are going to be the important thing. It will be heavily based on the music ... no bells and whistles just yet, we're going to try and keep it quite pure."

Watch "Lover to Lover" below:

leahc@dose.ca

source.title: Florence + The Machine Debut 'Lover to Lover' Video, Rub In The Fact They're Not Touring Canada
source.subtitle: Florence + The Machine's new video for "Lover to Lover" is here. Watch it now.

entry.title: Adele Making Comeback at BRIT Awards; Will She Be Well Enough for a Grammy Gig, Too?

link.Abstract: Adele will play the BRIT Awards on Feb. 21, buoying hopes that the "Someone Like You" singer might also perform at the Grammy Awards Feb. 12.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Adele is confirmed to play the 2012 BRIT Awards on Feb. 21. Here she is at last year's show, shortly before her performance of "Someone Like You" caused a tsunami made of mascara and tears.
link.title: Adele BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift, Nicki Minaj, Kelly Clarkson and the Foo Fighters are among the first acts confirmed to play the 54th Annual Grammy Awards February 12. Check out who else is booked for music's big night.
link.title: Look Who's Playing the Grammy Awards

link.Abstract: Adele's tour rider leaked and it's outrageous -- for all the right reasons. A lot of pop stars are way more demanding. We've compiled some of the more infamous examples.
link.title: Outrageous Tour Riders

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: Kanye West, Adele Lead Grammy Nominations

link.Abstract: Arcade Fire and Justin Bieber repped for Canada at the 2011 BRITs. The gong fest airs on MuchMusic Wednesday, Feb. 16 at 8 p.m. ET, but we've already got pictures from the show.
link.title: Photos: 2011 BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: The VMAs are about fun -- the sort of fun that, this year at least, involves drag and distended wombs and at least a little swapping of spit. Here are a few of Sunday night’s best (and worst) examples.
link.title: Best and Worst Moments at the 2011 MTV VMAs

link.Abstract: Harry Potter's Rupert Grint stars in a new video from English singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran. It's called "Lego House." Watch it here.
link.title: Harry Potter Star Rupert Grint's Latest Role? This Music Video

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine covered Drake's "Take Care" during an appearance at BBC 1's Live Lounge. Hear it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Take On Drake's 'Take Care'

link.Abstract: We're thrilled Chris Martin never made good on his promise to retire at 33. Here's why.
link.title: 10 Reasons To Be a Coldplay Fan

link.Abstract: Noel Gallagher took the stage in Toronto Nov. 7 for his first North American show as Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds -- or, rather, his first North American show not as a member of Oasis. Dose.ca was there.
link.title: Concert Review: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds at Massey Hall

entry.title: The 2012 Coachella Line-up Is Here; The Black Keys, Radiohead, Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg to Headline Back-to-Back Weekends

link.Abstract: The Black Keys, Radiohead and Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg will headline the 2012 Coachella festival, which will run as back-to-back weekend events April 13-15 and April 20-22. The full line-up was announced Monday.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: That sweaty mob? It could be you! The line-up for Coachella 2012 is here.
link.title: Coachella

link.Abstract: Arcade Fire, Kanye West, The Strokes and a metric butt-load of other awesome bands played the 2011 edition of Coachella, in Indio, CA April 15-17. We've got the pictures.
link.title: Photos: Coachella 2011

link.Abstract: From Madge to Minaj, these are the albums Dose.ca is looking forward to in early 2012.
link.title: Spring 2012 Music Preview

link.Abstract: When the Black Keys started out, "the music industry needed a kick in the pants." Now the blues-rock duo is winning Grammys and topping charts. Their latest album, El Camino, is out today.
link.title: Interview: The Black Keys on Rock 'n' Roll and Kicking Butt

link.Abstract: Listen up! We've got reviews of new music from Amy Winehouse, The Black Keys, Charlotte Gainsbourg, The Roots and Robin Thicke.
link.title: Album Reviews (Amy Winehouse, The Black Keys, The Roots and More)

link.Abstract: The rapper posed in his classic Westside cruising style before helping Daria look-a-like Alexis take home a mint 1962 Lincoln Continental Convertible.
link.title: Watch Snoop Dogg Help a Hipster Win a Vintage Car on The Price is Right

link.Abstract: The Weeknd is holding an open call for auditions. The Toronto R&B act behind House of Balloons is seeking a guitarist and bass player, suggesting concert dates may be in the cards.
link.title: The Weeknd Wants You! (So Long As You're Awesome on Guitar And/Or Bass and Live in Toronto)
